pullRequest.title: Deployment service integration
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:
Integration of deployment service, package manager and kernel. This is for the first end to end demo.
Why is this change necessary:
Sprint goal to do end to end demo
How was this change tested:
Functional testing has been done by triggering a job using AWS IoT Jobs console.
Any additional information or context required to review the change:
We have tasks in next sprint to refactor the model classes used across deployment service and package manager. There will also be refactor of the deployment service state machine
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

commit.message: Integrating with Package manger and resolve configuration APIs

nodes.bodyText: Go ahead and make all of these final unless you do write to them more than once.

[typo]
validating

I don't think this log will work really since you haven't provided a placeholder ({}). But you should probably add it as a k-v pair instead, like logger.atInfo().addKeyValue("deploymentPacket", deploymentPacket).log("Package downloaded...")

For our logging, when you have put a k-v pair then don't use a message that sounds like it wants a placeholder. I think the better way to do this would be logger.atInfo().setEventType("deployment-state-machine-end").addKeyValue(...).log()
Log exception, or at least rethrow so the caller can handle it?
final?
Convert this to a lambda. Also, make all these final when they can be.
remove the trailing space from your log message.
Use {} or use a k-v pair.
Same here, make this a lambda and final if possible.
For our structured logs we'll probably want the jobId as a k-v pair too, can you add that to all the logs which are processing a job? That way we can easily trace logs back to their jobs.
This is duplicated from L157.
Pick 1, we shouldn't log multiple times for the same error.
Let's not have these paths be relative to $HOME. Can we just define the paths in the config as absolute?

You can just do this at the field level.
private static final ObjectMapper OBJECT_MAPPER = new ObjectMapper().configure(DeserializationFeature......)
Why are these classes "Configurations"? Perhaps just DeploymentDocument and DeploymentPackage (or even PackageFromDeployment)?
Can we pull this out of this class? It seems like we may want to use this type in more places, especially if we're getting rid of some of the package classes.
We already have a parameter class somewhere. Can you use that one instead of making a new one?
Make this abstract?
Remove this error log. (keep the one above though, that's fine)
GIVEN.

As discussed yesterday, I made changes to package model to never have null values, so that we don't keep making null checks everywhere we use them, so this can be removed, would be another branch to cover in testing otherwise
Update javadoc to reflect all parameters
Might want to name this resolvedPackagesToDeploy now to make it less confusing how it's different from proposedPackagesFromDeployment
This is only used in one state, it can be moved to that state, doesn't need to be in base class. You have to instantiate states with this when you don't even need it
Could have a constructor in base class and call super class constructor here
Why is this not final anymore?
What's groupName?
Is this deployment creation timestamp on the cloud?
Probably DeploymentDocument is better. Configuration is a bit overloaded.
Yeah. This should be the "primary key" referring each package.
What is DeploymentPacket?
